headline: Why Palantir (PLTR) Shares Are Plunging Today
summary: Shares of data-mining and analytics company Palantir (NYSE:PLTR) fell 5.9% in the afternoon session after stocks pulled back (Nasdaq -1.5%, S&P 500 -1.2%) amid fresh concerns about trade tariffs. The pullback followed comments from President Trump clarifying the scope of his administration's 25% tariffs on Venezuela. He noted that it would apply to any country that does business with Venezuela. For example, 25% is on top of the already-in-place 20% tariff on China because China imports oil from

headline: Why a Top Technical Strategist Is Bullish on Palantir (PLTR) Stock
summary: Palantir (PLTR) looks poised to continue to climb going forward, Larry Tentarelli, chief technical strategist at the Blue Chip Trend Report, told Schwab Network late yesterday. Since the name did not break below its 100-day moving average during the market’s recent pullback, PLTR stock is likely to be one of the “leaders” as the market […]
